dt: {bc}the quality or property of an object that defines its possible uses or makes clear how it can or should be used

dt.t: We sit or stand on a chair because those {wi}affordances{/wi} are fairly obvious.
An {wi}affordance{/wi} is a resource or support that the environment offers an animal; the animal in turn must possess the capabilities to perceive it and to use it.

et: As a term in the study of cognition introduced by the American psychologist James J. Gibson (1904-79) in {it}The Senses Considered as Perceptual Systems{/it} (Boston, 1966) and later essays.
shortdef: the quality or property of an object that defines its possible uses or makes clear how it can or should be used
